metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20267 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in openstack-neutron's default Open vSwitch firewall rules. By sending carefully crafted packets, anyone in control of a server instance connected to the virtual switch can impersonate the IPv6 addresses of other systems on the network, resulting in denial of service or in some cases possibly interception of traffic intended for other destinations. Only deployments using the Open vSwitch driver are affected. Source: OpenStack project. Versions before openstack-neutron 15.3.3, openstack-neutron 16.3.1 and openstack-neutron 17.1.1 are affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20267` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-dhcp-agent - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-l3-agent - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-linuxbridge-agent - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-macvtap-agent - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-metadata-agent - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-metering-agent - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-openvswitch-agent - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-ovn-metadata-agent - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-server - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
neutron-sriov-agent - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
python3-neutron - 2:18.1.0+git2021072117.147830620f-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream Affects: <15.3.3, >=16.0.0 <16.3.1, >=17.0.0 <17.1.1 as of 2021-05-13, patch has been flagged as possibly incomplete see comment #17 in upstream bug. addditional patch: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/783743  This issue was fixed in (2:16.4.0-0ubuntu2) in focal-updates and (2:18.1.0-0ubuntu2) in hirsute-updates, and was later released to -security.
